item.title: [PHP] Using mysql databases
item.dc:creator: @MastrChief MastrChief
item.description:
@MastrChief wrote:

Ok, I have modified and tested the source, one of the obvious problems was you used $POST[“variable”] when it should be $_POST[“variable”], notice the underscore, its needed.

Anyway:

[code]

<?php // Connect to mysql database $con = mysql_connect('localhost', 'db_username', 'db_password'); if (!$con) { die('Could not connect: ' . mysql_error()); } // Select database mysql_select_db('database'); echo "Connected sucessfully.

"; if (($_POST["name"] != NULL) && ($_POST["pass"] != NULL)) { // Enter data $username = mysql_real_escape_string(strip_tags($_POST["name"])); $password = mysql_real_escape_string(strip_tags($_POST["pass"])); echo 'Username: ' . $username . '
Password: ' . $password . '

'; mysql_query("INSERT INTO `accounts` (`Username`, `Password`, `Level`, `XP`, `Levelat`) VALUES ('$username', '$password', '1', '0', '100')"); // Close Connection mysql_close($con); echo "Data entered sucessfully."; } else { echo 'Error. All data must be filled in.'; } ?>[/code]

http://www.chatshack.us/mysql.php

Edit: To the user trying to use javascript injection, you’re wasting your time.

Read full topic

item.title: [PHP] Using mysql databases
item.dc:creator: @Daed Daed
item.description:
@Daed wrote:



Warning: mysql_real_escape_string() [function.mysql-real-escape-string]: Can't connect to local MySQL server through socket '/usr/local/mysql-5.0/data/mysql.sock' (2) in /home/content/s/h/e/shellmodule/html/register.php on line 3

Warning: mysql_real_escape_string() [function.mysql-real-escape-string]: A link to the server could not be established in /home/content/s/h/e/shellmodule/html/register.php on line 3

Warning: mysql_real_escape_string() [function.mysql-real-escape-string]: Can't connect to local MySQL server through socket '/usr/local/mysql-5.0/data/mysql.sock' (2) in /home/content/s/h/e/shellmodule/html/register.php on line 4

Warning: mysql_real_escape_string() [function.mysql-real-escape-string]: A link to the server could not be established in /home/content/s/h/e/shellmodule/html/register.php on line 4
Connected sucessfully.
Data entered sucessfully.

Tested here: http://www.shellmodule.net

It doesnt seem to be adding any data as the database still says

Space usage    Type  	Usage
Data 	0 	      B
Index 	1,024 	   B
Total 	1,024 	    B

hehe :D[table][tr][td][/td][/tr][/table]

item.title: [PHP] Using mysql databases
item.dc:creator: @MastrChief MastrChief
item.description:
@MastrChief wrote:

Try

[code]

<?php $username = mysql_real_escape_string($POST["name"]); $password = mysql_real_escape_string($POST["pass"]); // Connect to mysql database $con = mysql_connect("mysite","myusername","mypassword"); if (!$con) { die('Could not connect: ' . mysql_error()); } echo "Connected sucessfully."; // Select database mysql_select_db("accounts", $con); // Enter data mysql_query("INSERT INTO `accounts` (`Username`, `Password`, `Level`, `XP`, `Levelat`) VALUES ('$username', '$password', '1', '0', '100')"); // Close Connection mysql_close($con); echo "
Data entered sucessfully."; ?>[/code]

Or take a look at http://www.chatshack.us/forum/index.php?topic=1363.0

Read full topic

item.title: [PHP] Using mysql databases
item.dc:creator: @Daed Daed
item.description:
@Daed wrote:

You can test the whole thing here!

shellmodule.phpnet.us/PHP/mysql.html

Error: When clicking create account it loads connect.php but still shows mysql.html?
Error: Before i created the form it still would not insert the data?

Mysql.html 

<html>
<body>
<img src="http://www.mysql.com/common/logos/mysql_100x52-64.gif"> <br />
<form action="connect.php" method="post">
Username: <input type="text" name="name" /> <br />
Password: <input type="password" name="pass" /> <br />
<input type="submit" value="Create Account" />
</form>
</body>
</html>

connect.php
details blanked with ‘my’

<?php

$username = $POST["name"];
$password = $POST["pass"];

// Connect to mysql database

$con = mysql_connect("mysite","myusername","mypassword");
if (!$con)
  {
  die('Could not connect: ' . mysql_error());
  }

echo "Connected sucessfully.";

// Select database

mysql_select_db("accounts", $con);

// Enter data

mysql_query("INSERT INTO accounts (Username, Password, Level, XP, Levelat) 
VALUES ($username, $password, '1', '0', '100')");

// Close Connection

mysql_close($con);
?><br /><?php
echo "Data entered sucessfully.";
?>
